translation:
Having been addressed to me by the Illustrious Sir on the 26th of June last, with the purpose of informing me of the rebellion in Porto Alegre, the release of the individuals imprisoned there and the arrest of Marciano, Silvano, and more than fifty other companions, and that forces from São Leopoldo had marched to the capital to support the lawful legitimate party of order, in return for such an important notice, and, above all, pledged by the polite expressions of His Excellency on the 10th of the current month; adding that on the 11th another force from the Division of the Superior Commander Silva Tavares, stationed at the pontas do Chasqueiro under the command of Cirilo, was attacked and destroyed by another force under the command of Lieutenant João Simplício, Cirilo and only two men having escaped, the prisoners already being at the Farroupilha fort.

I take advantage of the occasion to offer the respects and consideration to the Illustrious Sir.  
Pelotas, 14th of September, 1836.  
Domingos José de Almeida.  
Colonel Chief of the Legion of the Comarca of Rio Grande.
